oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The History of Country Music - Volume 1 - Recording 2 - Side 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country music history program with voice overs and commercial recordings prepared for radio broadcast. Internet sources say the producer and narrator is Lee Cash. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music, and recording is likely a syndicated radio show. The tape focuses primarily on Hank Williams (singer/song-writer) Tape is labeled as: volume one, recording two, side one.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified]) -- (00:05) An unidentified speaker introduces "Wabash Cannonball" and Roy Acuff -- (00:18) Roy Acuff discusses his artistic decisions for the "Wabash Cannonball" -- (00:27) Wabash Cannonball [featuring Roy Acuff voiceover] (Roy Acuff) -- (02:55) An unidentified speaker discusses Red Foley at Studio B and "Filipino Baby" -- (03:17) Filipino Baby (Cowboy Copas) -- (05:57) An unidentified speaker discusses Harry S. Truman's experience with the hydrogen bomb, and the speaker introduces "I'll Sail My Ship Alone" -- (06:24) I'll Sail My Ship Alone (Moon Mullican) -- (08:30) An unidentified speaker introduces Hank Williams -- (09:05) Acuff reflects on the first introduction of Williams at the Grand Ole Opry -- (09:46) Minnie Pearl reflects on the experience of hearing Williams -- (09:54) Lovesick Blues (Hank Williams) -- (12:35) An unidentified speaker reflects on Williams' soul, and Minnie Pearl reflect on William' depression -- (13:28) Acuff reflects on how Williams began to spiral -- (14:08) I'm so Lonesome I Could Cry (Hank Williams) -- (16:41)An unidentified speaker tells about when Williams had died -- (17:14) Your Cheatin' Heart (Hank Williams) -- (19:44) An unidentified speaker introduces Pearl to reflect on the last time she was with Williams -- (21:16) I Saw the Light (Hank Williams) -- (23:45) An unidentified speaker declares Williams to be dead -- (24:19) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Cash, Lee; Radio programs; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
